title: Serbia and Kosovo end license plate dispute
description: In Brussels, Serbian and Kosovar negotiators reached an agreement on an issue that has poisoned relations for months. The European Union hopes to resume discussions quickly for the final normalization of their relations.

title: World Cup: Neymar injured during Brazil vs. Serbia
description: Brazil captain Neymar suffered an ankle injury in his team's World Cup win over Serbia on Thursday and faces a medical assessment in the next 48 hours, a team doctor said. Brazil won 2-0.

title: The 'hidden costs' of pesticides could amount to €370 million to several billion per year for France
description: A team of researchers has estimated the amount of money spent on dealing with the damaging health and environmental impacts of chemical use in agriculture and their management costs.

title: Mélenchon's party plunges deeper into crisis after Quatennens accused of repeated abuse
description: New accusations of domestic violence by Mélenchon's deputy have emerged. His wife Céline Quatennens has accused him of 'physical and emotional abuse' over 'several years,' which he denies.

title: In Jakarta, young people from poor suburbs create symbolic 'fashion week'
description: A pedestrian passageway in the capital's business district has become the place to be for disadvantaged young people to stand out from the crowd by parading like models.

title: French Government continues to believe in the IPO of start-ups
description: Measures facilitating access to the stock markets for French digital start-ups were unveiled on Wednesday, despite tech's current financial woes.

title: Right to abortion in France: The necessary steps before it gets enshrined in the constitution
description: The Assemblée Nationale adopted a text supported by the left aimed at writing the right to abortion into the French Constitution. But the outcome is far from being a foregone conclusion.

title: Ronaldo makes World Cup history as Portugal beats Ghana in tight 3-2 match
description: The Portuguese football icon has scored in the last five World Cups.

title: UN Human Rights Council condemns Iran's brutal repression of peaceful protest
description: The council overwhelmingly voted in favor of launching an investigation into Iran's treatement of protesters.

title: 'Wednesday': The return of the Addams Family's enfant terrible
description: Wednesday Addams is back as a gothic teenager in an eight-part series on Netflix, with the first half directed by who else but Tim Burton.

title: Adidas launches probe into allegations about Kanye West's behavior
description: According to allegations, Kanye West routinely showed pornographic images and videos of Kim Kardashian to his employees and Adidas employees.

title: Rule of law: A financial noose is tightening around Hungary's neck
description: The European Commission wants to deprive Budapest of €7.5 billion from the Cohesion Fund.

title: Hungary set to approve Finland and Sweden's NATO membership early next year
description: Once Hungary passes it, Turkey will be the only NATO member left to ratify their accesion.

title: French parliament votes to enshrine abortion as constitutional right
description: The Assemblée Nationale vote was in line with over 80% of the French population, who support the right to abortion.

title: Russian dissident journalist asked to leave Sweden
description: Journalist and writer Elisabeth Alexandrova-Zorina, who is married to a Swedish man and has a 14-month-old son, has been refused family-motivated residency. Stockholm is demanding that she return to Russia.

title: Iran arrests popular footballer Ghafouri over anti-state 'propaganda'
description: Iran detained this prominent former national footballer over spreading 'propaganda' against the state after he posted a photo on Instagram of himself wearing traditional Kurdish dress.

title: The French government is developing a new ultra-secure phone for Emmanuel Macron
description: French authorities are looking to modernize their current encrypted telecommunication tools, which are secure but slower and more rigid than those of the GAFAM.

title: Alessandro Michele steps down as Gucci creative director
description: The Roman designer has spent 20 years with the Italian house, bringing baroque romanticism and bohemian references to the storied brand.

title: The cities including mental health in their urban policies
description: Even though this is not one of their prerogatives, municipalities are committed to de-stigmatizing this issue, identifying the needs of the population and working on solutions.

title: How Taylor Swift rose from 'Miss Americana' to global pop star
description: Back with her 10th album, the singer continues to break records over a decade into her career.

title: Left-wing coalition LFI upsets the balance in French assembly over abortion and ban on bullfighting
description: By bringing divisive issues to the table, MPs from La France Insoumise sow seeds of discord in the majority and cause embarrassment to their own allies on the left.

title: French regulators try to put pressure on Twitter and Elon Musk
description: ARCOM, which is in charge of supervising digital platforms, sent an initial ultimatum to the social media platform. Similar efforts are taking place on the European and American levels.

title: War in Ukraine: Russian missiles target civilians and infrastructure
description: A new wave of Russian missiles hit Ukrainian civilian infrastructure on Wednesday, plunging parts of the country, including Kyiv, into darkness and killing at least 10.

title: Thanksgiving: In Minneapolis, Owamni puts indigenous cuisine on the menu
description: In his Minneapolis restaurant, chef Sean Sherman promotes the culinary culture of his ancestors.

title: The undermining of Europe's financial transparency
description: The European Court of Justice's decision on Tuesday to overturn a provision of the anti-money laundering directive risks plunging Europe back into financial opacity.

title: Nice attack trial: Alleged accomplice exchanged messages with attacker about driving truck into crowd
description: A 46-year-old Tunisian man was questioned on Wednesday about Facebook conversations with Mohamed Lahouaiej-Bouhlel.

title: France banks on Uzbekistan to further isolate Russia
description: This approach is in line with the European Union's aims to consolidate ties with former Soviet republics in Central Asia.

title: Mired in a funding crisis, England struggles to care for its elderly and infirm
description: 'The English malaise' (4/6): In this series, 'Le Monde' examines the deepening crisis that England is enduring, marked by political instability and a deteriorating social climate.

title: Behind enemy lines, Ukrainian partisans played a key role in the battle for Kherson
description: In parallel with Ukrainian forces, civilians acted clandestinely in the territories occupied by Russians.

title: UK Supreme Court blocks Scottish independence referendum
description: According to a ruling by the UK's top court, Holyrood cannot hold a second consultation without the approval of Westminster.

title: Deaths in the Channel: 'British and French authorities are furthering their mission to make the border space into a fundamentally hostile environment'
description: One year after the shipwreck that led to the drowning of at least 27 people, as a new Franco-British agreement is signed, a group of 65 French, British and Belgian humanitarian associations raise unacceptable failures by French and British rescue services.

title: In a shift in views, Marine Le Pen supports constitutional protection for abortion access
description: Hoping to reconcile the contradictory positions within her parliamentary group, the far-right leader is proposing including the right to abortion in the French Constitution.

title: The growing threat of North Korea, which is launching missiles more frequently and at longer range
description: After hopes for appeasement between the two Koreas in 2018, Pyongyang is now ramping up missile tests. More than 75 missiles have already been fired in 2022.

title: World Cup 2022: Kylian Mbappé is already much more than a footballer
description: The French national team's 23-year-old striker has been reflecting on his place in the history of football, including shouldering the role of generational leader.

title: Luca Guadagnino creates a fanciful tale of cannibalism in Bones and All
description: The Italian filmmaker directs Tyler Russell and Timothée Chalamet who play two cannibals, helpless before their devouring impulse, in an extremely smooth love story.

title: Gang violence overwhelming the overseas territory of Mayotte
description: The French government announced that they are sending an anti-terrorist police unit to the island in the Indian Ocean after a series of machete-wielding attacks.

title: The collosal task of protecting shipwrecks
description: It is extremey difficult to detect the extent of the theft from shipwrecks in French waters. Faced with this phenomenon, archaeologists are policing shipwrecks from looters.

title: Air pollution caused 238,000 premature deaths in the EU in 2020
description: Overall, the rate for EU countries in 2020 was 45 percent lower than in 2005, the agency said: 'If this rate of decline is maintained, the EU will reach the aforementioned zero pollution action plan target before 2030.'

title: Brazilian court rejects Bolsonaro's attempt to invalidate election
description: The electoral authority also ordered the suspension of government funds for Mr. Bolsonaro's Liberal Party coalition until a fine of 23 million reais ($4.3 million) for bad faith litigation is paid.

title: Ocean Viking migrants: The French government was forced to follow the rule of law
description: While France's Minister of the Interior promised dozens of deportations, almost all the survivors were integrated into the national reception system for asylum seekers.
